clinicalSignificance.comment: This c.320A>G (p.His107Arg) variant in PAH was reported in 22 patients with PAH deficiency (>120 uMol/L Phe), detected in trans in 16 patients with pathogenic variants p.Arg111*, p.Arg400Thr, p.Val399=, p.Val399=, p.Arg241Cys, p.Arg241Cys, p.Arg413Pro, p.Gly257Val, p.His107Arg, p.Arg243Gln, p.His220Pro, p.Arg176*, p.Arg243Gln, p.Arg243Gln, p.Val230Ile, p.Ile65Thr (PMID: 28982351). Computational evidence for this variant is conflicting; predicted to be tolerated (SIFT), disease-causing (MutationTaster) and benign (PolyPhen2). This variant is present in European (Non-Finnish) populations at extremely low frequencies in gnomAD (MAF=0.00002), ExAC (MAF=0.00001), and 1000 Genomes (MAF=0.00099). In summary, this variant meets criteria to be classified as pathogenic for PAH. PAH-specific ACMG/AMP criteria applied: PM2, PM3_very-strong, PP4.
